name: Andhra Pradesh
culture: Known for Kuchipudi dance, a classical Indian dance form, and vibrant festivals like Sankranti and Ugadi.

mustVisit.name: Tirumala Venkateswara Temple
mustVisit.description: One of the most visited and richest temples in the world, dedicated to Lord Venkateswara.

mustVisit.name: Visakhapatnam
mustVisit.description: A beautiful port city known for its pristine beaches and scenic landscapes.

name: Arunachal Pradesh
tagline: The Land of the Dawn-Lit Mountains
culture: Home to 26 major tribes and over 100 sub-tribes. Known for unique folk dances, handloom and handicrafts, and festivals like Losar and Solung.

mustVisit.name: Tawang Monastery
mustVisit.description: The largest monastery in India and the second largest in the world, Tawang is a major spiritual center for Buddhists.

mustVisit.name: Ziro Valley
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site nominee, famous for its lush green rice fields, pine groves, and the unique Apatani tribal culture.

name: Assam
culture: Known for the Bihu festival, Assamese tea plantations, and its unique blend of indigenous and Vaishnavite traditions.

mustVisit.name: Kaziranga National Park
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and home to the world's largest population of one-horned rhinoceroses.

mustVisit.name: Kamakhya Temple
mustVisit.description: A revered Hindu pilgrimage site dedicated to the goddess Kamakhya, located on Nilachal Hill in Guwahati.

name: Meghalaya
culture: Home to the Khasi, Garo, and Jaintia tribes. Famous for living root bridges and matriarchal societies.

mustVisit.name: Double Decker Living Root Bridge
mustVisit.description: A remarkable bio-engineering marvel created by the Khasi people from the roots of the Ficus elastica tree.

mustVisit.name: Nohkalikai Falls
mustVisit.description: India's tallest plunge waterfall, located near Cherrapunji, one of the wettest places on earth.

name: Bihar
culture: A spiritual and historical hub with a rich legacy from the Maurya and Gupta empires, known for Buddhist and Jain pilgrimage sites.

mustVisit.name: Mahabodhi Temple
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site where Siddhartha Gautama is said to have attained enlightenment and become the Buddha.

mustVisit.name: Nalanda University Ruins
mustVisit.description: The remnants of an ancient center of learning and a Buddhist monastery, considered one of the first great universities in the world.

name: Chhattisgarh
culture: A tribal state with a rich folk culture, ancient temples, and stunning natural landscapes. Known for its traditional arts and crafts.

mustVisit.name: Chitrakote Falls
mustVisit.description: Often called 'The Niagara Falls of India,' it is the widest waterfall in the country, located on the Indravati River.

mustVisit.name: Bhoramdeo Temple
mustVisit.description: An 11th-century temple complex dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its intricate carvings and resemblance to the Khajuraho temples.

name: Goa
culture: A unique blend of Indian and Portuguese cultures, famous for its laid-back lifestyle, vibrant nightlife, and grand carnivals.

mustVisit.name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site that holds the mortal remains of St. Francis Xavier, a revered saint.

mustVisit.name: Dudhsagar Falls
mustVisit.description: A spectacular four-tiered waterfall located on the Mandovi River, a popular spot for trekking and nature lovers.

name: Gujarat
culture: Known for vibrant festivals like Navratri, where people perform **Garba** and **Dandiya Raas**. It's a land of rich traditions, intricate handicrafts, and a predominantly vegetarian cuisine.

mustVisit.name: Statue of Unity
mustVisit.description: The world's tallest statue, dedicated to **Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel**. It is a major engineering and tourism marvel.

mustVisit.name: Dwarkadhish Temple
mustVisit.description: A revered Hindu pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Krishna, one of the **Char Dham** pilgrimage sites.

name: Haryana
culture: A state with a deep connection to the epic Mahabharata. It's known for its agricultural prosperity and traditional folk dances.

mustVisit.name: Kurukshetra
mustVisit.description: A city of immense historical and spiritual significance, believed to be the battlefield of the **Mahabharata**.

mustVisit.name: Sultanpur National Park
mustVisit.description: A popular bird sanctuary, home to a large number of migratory birds from all over the world.

name: Himachal Pradesh
culture: A land of serene landscapes and a strong spiritual vibe. The culture is a blend of local traditions and Buddhist influence from Tibet.

mustVisit.name: Shimla
mustVisit.description: The capital city, a popular hill station known for its pleasant weather and colonial architecture.

mustVisit.name: Manali
mustVisit.description: A high-altitude resort town serving as a gateway for skiing, trekking, and adventure sports in the Himalayas.

name: Jharkhand
culture: A state with a rich tribal heritage, distinct folk music, and vibrant festivals like **Sarhul**. The culture is deeply connected to nature and forests.

mustVisit.name: Betla National Park
mustVisit.description: One of the first national parks in India to be declared a tiger reserve. It's home to a wide variety of wildlife.

mustVisit.name: Hundru Falls
mustVisit.description: A magnificent waterfall near Ranchi, where the Subarnarekha River falls from a height of over 300 feet.

name: Karnataka
culture: A land of ancient empires and modern innovation. It's known for its classical music and dance, vibrant silk saris, and the magnificent **Mysuru Dasara** festival.

mustVisit.name: Hampi
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site that was once the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire. Its ruins are spread over a vast, boulder-strewn landscape.

mustVisit.name: Mysore Palace
mustVisit.description: The official residence of the Wadiyar dynasty and the seat of the Kingdom of Mysore. It's an architectural marvel, especially when lit up at night.

name: Kerala
culture: Famed for its tranquil backwaters, lush green landscapes, and a vibrant culture that includes classical dance forms like **Kathakali** and the traditional festival of **Onam**.

mustVisit.name: Alleppey Backwaters
mustVisit.description: A network of canals, lagoons, and lakes, best explored on a houseboat to experience the serene rural life of Kerala.

mustVisit.name: Munnar
mustVisit.description: A popular hill station renowned for its vast tea plantations, misty mountains, and biodiversity.

name: Madhya Pradesh
culture: A state with a rich history, ancient monuments, and diverse tribal communities. It's known for its unique art forms, music, and the **Khajuraho Dance Festival**.

mustVisit.name: Khajuraho Temples
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site famous for its intricate and erotic sculptures that depict various aspects of life and human emotions.

mustVisit.name: Kanha National Park
mustVisit.description: One of the most famous tiger reserves in India, believed to be the inspiration for Rudyard Kipling's 'The Jungle Book'.

name: Maharashtra
culture: A state with a vibrant and diverse culture, heavily influenced by its cinematic industry, the legacy of the **Maratha Empire**, and festivals like **Ganesh Chaturthi**.

mustVisit.name: Ajanta and Ellora Caves
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site showcasing rock-cut cave monuments from the 2nd century BCE to about 480 CE, featuring both Buddhist and Hindu art.

mustVisit.name: Gateway of India
mustVisit.description: A monumental archway built to commemorate the visit of King George V and Queen Mary to Mumbai. It stands as a symbol of the city.

name: Manipur
culture: Known for its unique classical dance form **Manipuri Dance**, indigenous games like modern polo, and a deep respect for nature and tradition.

mustVisit.name: Loktak Lake
mustVisit.description: The largest freshwater lake in Northeast India, famous for its floating phumdis (heterogeneous mass of vegetation, soil, and organic matter).

mustVisit.name: Ima Keithel (Mother's Market)
mustVisit.description: A unique market run entirely by women, a symbol of women's empowerment in Manipur, where a wide range of goods are sold.

name: Mizoram
culture: A state with a rich tribal heritage and a Christian majority. It is famous for its bamboo dance, **Cheraw**, and the **Chapchar Kut** festival, which celebrates the spring season.

mustVisit.name: Phawngpui National Park
mustVisit.description: Also known as the **Blue Mountain**, this national park is a high-altitude peak and home to a variety of flora and fauna, including orchids and Rhododendron.

mustVisit.name: Aizawl
mustVisit.description: The capital city of Mizoram, offering a unique glimpse into the Mizo way of life and stunning views of the surrounding hills.

name: Nagaland
tagline: The Falcon Capital of the World
culture: Home to 16 major tribes, each with its own customs, traditions, and festivals. The annual **Hornbill Festival** is a grand celebration of the state's tribal heritage.

mustVisit.name: Dzukou Valley
mustVisit.description: A trekking paradise located on the border of Nagaland and Manipur, known for its pristine natural beauty and seasonal flowers.

mustVisit.name: Kohima War Cemetery
mustVisit.description: A somber memorial dedicated to the soldiers of the Allied forces who died in World War II at the Battle of Kohima.

name: Odisha
culture: A land of ancient temples, classical art, and the dance form **Odissi**. The **Rath Yatra** in Puri is a major religious event that draws millions of devotees.

mustVisit.name: Konark Sun Temple
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site designed in the shape of a colossal chariot with twelve pairs of intricately carved wheels.

mustVisit.name: Puri
mustVisit.description: A revered pilgrimage city and one of the four **Char Dham** destinations, famous for the Jagannath Temple and its beautiful beaches.

name: Punjab
culture: Known for its vibrant and energetic spirit, reflected in its folk dances **Bhangra** and **Gidda**. It is the birthplace of Sikhism and a hub of agricultural prosperity.
cuisine: Makki di Roti with Sarson da Saag

mustVisit.name: Golden Temple (Harmandir Sahib)
mustVisit.description: The holiest gurdwara of Sikhism, revered for its stunning architecture and spiritual significance. The community kitchen serves millions of people.

mustVisit.name: Wagah Border
mustVisit.description: The border crossing between India and Pakistan, famous for its elaborate and synchronized military ceremony known as the **Wagah-Attari Border Ceremony**.

name: Rajasthan
culture: Known for its vibrant and colorful culture, grand forts, opulent palaces, and rich history of kings and queens. The folk dances like **Ghoomar** and **Kalbelia** are world-renowned.

mustVisit.name: Jaipur City Palace
mustVisit.description: A magnificent palace complex in the heart of Jaipur, showcasing a blend of Rajput and Mughal architecture. It houses a museum with royal artifacts.

mustVisit.name: Jaisalmer Fort
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, often called the 'Golden Fort,' as it is made of yellow sandstone and appears to be a shimmering golden castle at sunset.

name: Sikkim
culture: A serene Himalayan state with a rich Buddhist heritage, home to numerous monasteries and vibrant festivals that reflect a blend of Tibetan and Nepalese cultures.

mustVisit.name: Tsomgo Lake
mustVisit.description: A sacred glacial lake located at an altitude of over 12,000 feet, known for its changing colors and yak rides.

mustVisit.name: Rumtek Monastery
mustVisit.description: One of Sikkim's largest and most significant monasteries, serving as a center of the Kagyu lineage of Tibetan Buddhism.

name: Tamil Nadu
culture: A state with an ancient and vibrant Dravidian culture. It is the cradle of classical arts like Bharatanatyam and is known for its grand temples and traditional festivals.

mustVisit.name: Meenakshi Amman Temple
mustVisit.description: A historic Hindu temple in Madurai dedicated to the goddess Meenakshi, known for its impressive architecture and intricate sculptures.

mustVisit.name: Mahabalipuram
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site with a collection of 7th and 8th-century religious monuments, including the famous Shore Temple.

name: Telangana
culture: A state with a rich blend of North and South Indian cultures, reflecting the legacy of the Nizams of Hyderabad and traditional Telugu traditions.

mustVisit.name: Charminar
mustVisit.description: An iconic monument and mosque located in Hyderabad, known for its elegant design and historical significance.

mustVisit.name: Golconda Fort
mustVisit.description: A magnificent fortress and former capital of the Qutb Shahi dynasty, famous for its sound and light show and unique acoustics.

name: Tripura
culture: A state with a deep tribal heritage alongside a strong Bengali influence. It is known for its beautiful palaces, handloom fabrics, and traditional bamboo and cane handicrafts.

mustVisit.name: Ujjayanta Palace
mustVisit.description: A former royal palace that now serves as the state museum, showcasing the lifestyle and history of the Tripura kings.

mustVisit.name: Neermahal
mustVisit.description: A magnificent water palace built in the middle of Rudrasagar Lake, combining Hindu and Islamic architectural styles.

name: Uttar Pradesh
culture: The most populous state and the heartland of India's history and mythology. It is the birthplace of Lord Rama and Krishna and is home to the timeless Taj Mahal.

mustVisit.name: Taj Mahal
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the Seven Wonders of the World, an ivory-white marble mausoleum built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan.

mustVisit.name: Varanasi
mustVisit.description: The spiritual capital of India, known for its sacred ghats on the Ganges River where pilgrims perform rituals.

name: Uttarakhand
culture: A spiritual and adventure hub nestled in the Himalayas. It is home to the Char Dham pilgrimage sites and is a popular destination for trekking, rafting, and yoga.

mustVisit.name: Rishikesh
mustVisit.description: Known as the 'Yoga Capital of the World,' a spiritual town on the Ganges River, famous for its temples and adventure sports.

mustVisit.name: Nainital
mustVisit.description: A beautiful hill station centered around the pear-shaped Naini Lake. It's a popular spot for boating and a tranquil getaway.

name: West Bengal
culture: A state known for its intellectual and artistic legacy, unique sweets, and the grand **Durga Puja** festival. It is the birthplace of literary giants like Rabindranath Tagore.

mustVisit.name: Sundarbans National Park
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and the world's largest mangrove forest, home to the elusive **Royal Bengal Tiger**.

mustVisit.name: Darjeeling
mustVisit.description: A famous hill station and tea-producing region, known for its scenic views of the Himalayas, including Mount Kanchenjunga.

name: Andaman and Nicobar Islands
culture: A mix of indigenous tribal communities and settlers from mainland India. The islands are a paradise for water sports and exploring pristine nature.

mustVisit.name: Cellular Jail
mustVisit.description: A former British colonial prison, now a national memorial that tells the story of India's freedom fighters.

mustVisit.name: Radhanagar Beach
mustVisit.description: Voted as one of the best beaches in Asia, known for its white sand, turquoise water, and stunning sunset views.

name: Chandigarh
culture: A modern, well-planned city known for its unique urban design by Swiss-French architect Le Corbusier. It serves as the capital for both Punjab and Haryana.

mustVisit.name: Rock Garden
mustVisit.description: A famous sculpture garden created by artist Nek Chand, entirely from industrial waste and discarded items.

mustVisit.name: Sukhna Lake
mustVisit.description: A serene artificial lake at the foothills of the Himalayas, popular for boating and peaceful walks.

name: Dadra and Nagar Haveli and Daman and Diu
culture: A blend of Indian and Portuguese cultures, evident in its architecture, cuisine, and local traditions.
heritage: Church of Our Lady of Rosary

mustVisit.name: Fort of Diu
mustVisit.description: A large and imposing Portuguese fort overlooking the Arabian Sea, with an impressive lighthouse and cannons.

mustVisit.name: Jampore Beach
mustVisit.description: A tranquil beach known for its black sand and calm waters, making it ideal for swimming and leisurely strolls.

name: Delhi
culture: A melting pot of cultures, combining the historical grandeur of the Mughal and British empires with the hustle of a modern metropolis.

mustVisit.name: India Gate
mustVisit.description: A prominent war memorial and a symbol of Delhi, located on the ceremonial axis of Rajpath.

mustVisit.name: Humayun's Tomb
mustVisit.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site and the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun. It is an exquisite example of Mughal architecture.

name: Jammu and Kashmir
culture: A land of breathtaking natural beauty and a unique cultural blend of Kashmiri, Dogra, and Ladakhi traditions. It's known for its intricate handicrafts and Sufi music.

mustVisit.name: Dal Lake
mustVisit.description: Known as the 'Jewel in the Crown of Kashmir', this urban lake is famous for its houseboats and scenic beauty.

mustVisit.name: Gulmarg
mustVisit.description: A popular hill station and ski resort in the Pir Panjal range. It has one of the world's highest operating cable cars.

name: Lakshadweep
tagline: The Jewel of the Arabian Sea
culture: A unique island culture with strong influences from Kerala. The islands are a hub for snorkeling, diving, and other water sports.

mustVisit.name: Kavaratti
mustVisit.description: The capital of Lakshadweep, known for its pristine beaches, coconut groves, and beautiful mosques.

mustVisit.name: Bangaram Atoll
mustVisit.description: An uninhabited atoll known for its stunning coral reefs, clear waters, and vibrant marine life, making it a diver's paradise.

name: Puducherry
tagline: The French Riviera of the East
culture: A unique blend of French colonial heritage and traditional Tamil culture. The town is known for its serene ashrams and beautiful beaches.

mustVisit.name: Auroville
mustVisit.description: An experimental township intended to be a universal city where people of all nationalities, beliefs, and cultures can live in peace and harmony.

mustVisit.name: French Quarter
mustVisit.description: Known as the White Town, this area retains its colonial charm with pastel-colored villas, bougainvillea-covered walls, and French-style architecture.

name: Ladakh
culture: A high-altitude desert region with a predominantly Buddhist culture heavily influenced by Tibetan traditions. It's famous for its monasteries and breathtaking mountain landscapes.

mustVisit.name: Pangong Lake
mustVisit.description: A stunning high-altitude lake that is a major tourist attraction, famous for its deep blue waters that change color.

mustVisit.name: Leh Palace
mustVisit.description: A former royal palace that offers a panoramic view of the town of Leh and the surrounding Stok Kangri mountain range.
